### Primary
Primary colors are used for key components across the UI, such as prominent buttons, active states, and the tint of elevated surfaces.
### Secondary
Secondary colors are used for less prominent components in the UI, such as filter chips, and opportunities for additional for color expression.
### Tertiary
Tertiary roles are used for contrasting accents that can be used to balance primary and secondary colors or bring heightened attention to an element, such as an input field.
### Neutral
Neutral colors are used for surfaces and backgrounds, and high emphasis text and icons.
